attributes.action: Allow places of worship to open for private prayer and meditation
attributes.additional_details: Allowing churches and places of worship to open would provide comfort and consolation at a time of distress and would alleviate some of the collateral damage to the nation's mental health that the lockdown has caused.
attributes.background: We would like the UK Government to amend its COVID-19 guidance to permit churches and other places of worship in England to open for private prayer and meditation; and to seek to persuade the devolved administrations in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland to adopt similar proposals.
